alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 8:25PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR WEST CLEAR CREEK... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...West Clear Creek, including the following counties, in north central Arizona, Coconino. In west central Arizona, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks is imminent or occurring. Stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 822 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... West Clear Creek and Long Canyon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Indian Maiden Falls, Hanging Garden, Bullpen Day Use Area, Verde Lakes, Rocking River Ranch State Park and Clear Creek Campgrounds. - This includes the following swimming holes... Bull Pen Day Use Area, West Clear Creek near the campground and Indian Maiden Falls. This includes State Route 260 between mile markers 225 and 230. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
